title: The Trial of Mr. Toad
author: Adapted from Kenneth Grahame
description: Mr. Toad stands trial for taking a motor-car. His friends Rat and Badger watch in dismay as Toad cannot stop talking about speed.

characters.name: Judge
characters.description: Very serious and proud of the law. A good role for a child who wants to act important.

characters.name: Prosecutor
characters.description: Reads the charges clearly and properly.

characters.name: Mr. Toad
characters.description: Excited, boastful, and suddenly very sorry.

characters.name: Rat
characters.description: Toadâ€™s loyal friend. Kind, worried, and embarrassed.

characters.name: Badger
characters.description: Firm friend who believes in rules and responsibility.

beats.text: A courtroom. The Judge sits high. Mr. Toad stands below. Rat and Badger sit together, looking troubled.
Bring in the prisoner!
Your Honour, the prisoner is charged with stealing a motor-car and driving it at a dangerous speed.
Oh, Toad, Toad, this is very bad.
I told you to leave those motor-cars alone.
Prisoner, how do you plead?
Motor-cars! Beautiful motor-cars!
Beep beep!
That is not an answer.
He took the car without permission and drove it wildly.
You have disgraced us all, Toad.
Be quiet and listen to the court.
Prisoner, did you take the motor-car?
I took it, and I drove it, and I loved it.
Oh dear.
He crashed the motor-car and showed no remorse.
Say you are sorry, Toad.
I am very sorry.
He is incorrigible.
The court finds you guilty of stealing a motor-car.
Guilty!
You are sentenced to a long term of imprisonment.
Prison!
We will visit you and bring you books.
You must learn to control yourself.
Take him away.
Mr. Toad is led toward the door. He turns back to his friends.
Good-bye, Rat! Good-bye, Badger!
Oh, Toad, what will become of you?
This is a sad business.
Beep beep!
He is taken away. Rat sighs. Badger shakes his head. Curtain.
